qas.question: What was the site of the royal palace in the 12th century?
Who was in charge of the construction of the Notre Dame Cathedral?
Where was the University of Paris located?
Under who's reign was the construction of Notre Dame Cathedral?

context: By the end of the 12th century, Paris had become the political, economic, religious, and cultural capital of France. The <a0_0>Île de la Cité<a0_0/> was the site of the royal palace. In 1163, during the reign of <a3_0>Louis VII<a3_0/>, <a1_0>Maurice de Sully<a1_0/>, bishop of Paris, undertook the construction of the Notre Dame Cathedral at its eastern extremity. <a2_0>The Left Bank<a2_0/> was the site of the University of Paris, a corporation of students and teachers formed in the mid-12th century to train scholars first in theology, and later in canon law, medicine and the arts.
